intro: Chaydaia tonkinensis, commonly known as the Tonkin chaydaia, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its aromatic foliage. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments, often found in forest understories. Its flowers are small and clustered, usually appearing in umbels, and it produces seeds that are dispersed by wind. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
